name: Atmosphere
purpose: Warm, intimate, lived-in documentary scenes where the product sits naturally in real social flow. Tight crops, subtle clutter, low light glow. Never staged or polished.

hero_focus: Frame the product dead-centre inside casual flow: cards fanned mid-debate, decks mid-pass over tasting glasses.
Keep composition tight and lived-in, with slight believable clutter (coasters, matchbooks, notepads) but never pristine staging.
Cropping should highlight intimacy and proximity, not wide environment shots.

center_of_gravity: product sits within the central 50 to 60 percent of the frame
hands and props naturally encroach into the frame edges
avoid catalogue symmetry and perfectly aligned placement
background_behavior: soft blur on faces and background activity
textured walls and worn furniture cues

allowed_moments: a card slid across a scarred table
hand reaching for sal de gusano or citrus
quiet table moment with relaxed chatter
avoid_moments: clean product showcase with no humans

preferred.label: Urban loft with exposed brick
preferred.notes: Warm low light, textured interiors, real table clusters.

preferred.label: Low-lit neighbourhood bar
preferred.notes: Practical lamps, lived-in surfaces, casual crowd.

preferred.label: Backyard patio
preferred.notes: String lights, tight table clusters, relaxed night energy.

preferred.label: Cabin table
preferred.notes: Rustic wood, warm lamp glow, intimate group huddle.

preferred.label: Oaxaca-style cantina with clay walls
preferred.notes: Earthy textures, warm practical light, relatable grit.

face_visibility_rule.rule: No full faces ever. Only hands, partial faces, side profiles, faces turned away, or faces blurred/obscured by depth of field.
allowed_face_treatments: blocked by foreground hands or cards

framing_preferences: partial faces allowed only if cropped or blurred
group shots allowed only if faces are not fully visible

preferred_angles.label: Over-the-shoulder
preferred_angles.notes: Feels intimate and candid, faces naturally cropped/blurred.

preferred_angles.label: 45-degree table angle
preferred_angles.notes: Perfect for cards + glass + hands without portraits.

preferred_angles.label: Top-down flat lay
preferred_angles.notes: Only if it still feels messy and real, not staged.

preferred_angles.label: Macro close-crop
preferred_angles.notes: Great for card texture, glass rim, salt grains.

focus_targets_ranked: face card artwork and print detail

preferred.label: Warm low lamp glow
preferred.notes: Signature Atmosphere look, intimate amber warmth.

preferred.label: Golden hour low light
preferred.notes: Soft warm edges, long shadows, natural intimacy.

preferred.label: Candle glow
preferred.notes: Small highlights, soft shadows, cosy mood.

preferred.label: Bar practical light mix
preferred.notes: Uneven real-world light, table lamps, warm fixtures.

shadow_notes: texture visible on wood and clay

scale_locks: Playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches.
The card must fit fully inside one adult hand.
Card height should be roughly similar to the mezcal glass height.
No oversized cards, no poster-sized props.
positioning: Product is dead-centre but sits inside the moment, not staged as a billboard.
Cards should feel handled: slightly imperfect alignment, minor overlaps, natural angles.
If using card back plus face card, keep them paired naturally, not perfectly symmetrical.

prompt_fragments.style_line: photorealistic, documentary realism, warm intimate atmosphere, tactile textures, natural grain, shallow depth of field, soft lamp bokeh
prompt_fragments.atmosphere_line: product centered in casual flow, cards fanned mid-debate, deck mid-pass over tasting glass, tight crop for intimacy
prompt_fragments.environment_line: scarred wood table, slight clutter like coasters and matchbooks, low-lit bar or cantina glow, no pristine staging
prompt_fragments.wardrobe_line: tattoos, rolled-up sleeves, simple vests, rings, bracelets, worn denim, casual bar crew vibe
prompt_fragments.face_rule_line: no full faces: hands dominant, partial faces only if cropped or blurred

scene_moment_templates: Hands fan the cards mid-debate, glass nudged closer
A deck passes between tattooed hands under warm lamp glow
A card slides across the worn table, laughter blurred behind
Two hands compare cards, citrus and salt within reach
Cards hover mid-pass above a copita, table clutter alive
A hand taps a card beside the glass, friends leaning in
Cards spread casually, one finger points at the artwork
A card is revealed mid-conversation, soft glow and shadows
props_notes: Avoid any prop that introduces readable text (menus, labels, clear handwriting).
If a notepad appears, it must be blank or blurred beyond readability.

discover.nudge: Curiosity and education through subtle objects and agave cues, no readable notes.

play.nudge: Cheeky social banter and table energy, cards as the spark for conversation.

level_up.nudge: Show the cards guiding better sipping choices in a real moment.

hard_constraints_locked: no text overlays, no captions, no watermarks, no logos, no UI icons, no corner marks, no sparkles
no pristine studio staging, no glossy product-ad perfection, no sterile white backgrounds
no warped hands, no extra fingers
mezcal bottles must have blank or unbranded labels only
poured mezcal must be still liquid, never bubbly or fizzy
no readable text anywhere in the scene except on the reference card itself; all other writing must be blurred or illegible
playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches, fit fully in one adult hand, never oversized
mezcal glass must be a small clay copita or small tulip copita, not a tumbler or rocks glass
atmosphere rule: no full faces ever, only hands or partial/blurred/turned away faces

avoid_visuals: sterile clean table with no life

good_output_signals: tight crop with hands and product in frame
warm lamp bokeh and soft shadows
faces not fully visible (cropped or blurred)
product true scale and integrated naturally
